title: Bells Family — Rude Guy, Boy, Papa & Little Sister
description: Four bell players collide in 30 seconds of overlapping chaos. A rude guy loops pitch-shifted fragments of the cage_ambient cluster interruption (chewing gum between hits). A boy clangs an F#5 church bell with Bergman-film persistence. Papa hammers a D2 tubular bell with a custom 10-partial bright profile — double-whacking 35% of the time after schweinshaxe. Little sister on B5 glockenspiel giggles through 42 rapid-fire dings with sloppy tuning and detuned double-taps. No damper pedal — all tails ring into each other.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Diamonds = rude guy clusters, circles = boy’s church bell, squares = papa’s tubular bell, triangles = sister’s glockenspiel. 87 events in 30 seconds. Click to enlarge.
player_label: Bells Family — Rude Guy, Boy, Papa & Sister

title: The Dormitory of Dust — Quay Brothers Music Box
description: A music box winds up, plays a waltz in G major, and slowly runs down as the spring loses tension. Steel tine synthesis with pin-pluck transients and a characteristic metallic overtone at 5.4×. The spring model decelerates tempo from 108 BPM to 8 BPM while sagging pitch by 120 cents. Gear clicks, spring creaks, distant bell tolls. The last tine rings out alone in a dusty room.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Diamonds = melody tines, squares = bass tines, pentagons = distant bells, star = last tine. Section markers show the winding-down progression. Click to enlarge.
player_label: The Dormitory of Dust — Quay Music Box

title: Wind Bells — Tubular Bells in Breeze
description: Mid-range tubular bells stirred by wind. Sparse, gentle strikes with irregular timing — sometimes quick gusts, sometimes long silences. Pentatonic pitch set (C–D–E–G–A) so any random overlap is consonant. Each bell rings until it naturally dies out via exponential partial decay. ±8 cents of microtonal drift per strike because wind doesn’t hit perfectly. Cathedral reverb. Additive bell synthesis with inharmonic partials.
score_caption: Graphical Score — 48 events over 2 minutes. Hexagons = tubular bell strikes, size = amplitude. Sparse wind-blown timing. Click to enlarge.
player_label: Wind Bells — Tubular Bells in Breeze

title: Berg Extended — Lyrical Serialism
description: Seven cycles of development through Berg's triadic row (Violin Concerto concept). Emergence → Awakening → Waltz → Tonal Heart → Storm → Remembrance → Dissolution. Each cycle transposes the row, re-orchestrates, and varies density. The "loop" is classical variation form — same process, different content.
score_caption: Graphical Score — 7 cycles of variation across 7 minutes. Bars = strings/winds, diamonds = bells/glass. Click to enlarge.

title: Bells + Bergman Clock
description: Layered glockenspiel, celesta, tubular bells, church bells, and wind chimes over a relentless tick-tock metronome at 63 BPM (deliberately off 60 — more unsettling). True bell partials with the characteristic tierce (minor 3rd at 1.183×). Tonal: D Dorian → A Mixolydian → G Major → D Minor. The clock never stops.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Diamonds = glockenspiel, circles = celesta, squares = tubular bell, pentagons = church bell, stars = wind chime. Click to enlarge.

title: Bells + Pizzicato Clock
description: Variation on Bergman Clock: the mechanical tick-tock replaced by a deeper pizzicato pattern at 72 BPM — alternating A2/E3 with ornamental turns and two-note pickup figures from A minor pentatonic. Heavier tubular bells in E Phrygian, church bell toll at 48s, tubular bell chords in D minor.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Circles = pizzicato clock, squares = tubular bells, pentagons = church bell. Click to enlarge.

title: Bells Gentle — For Tanya
description: Wood xylophone synthesis (rosewood bars with resonator tubes) and marimba (rubber mallets, warmer). Gentle pizzicato clock at 66 BPM. Everything stays pp–mp — no sudden loud bells, no metallic toy sounds. Modal journey: A pentatonic → D Dorian → G Lydian → F major → A pentatonic. Tubular bells appear only twice at whisper level.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Squares = xylophone/marimba, circles = pizzicato, tubular bells barely visible. Click to enlarge.

title: Tubular Bells — Low Register
description: 100% tubular bells, low register only (octaves 2–4). D minor pentatonic with natural minor coloring. Four layers: slow tolling → overlapping rings → arpeggiated figures → chordal swells. Three anchor bells frame the structure: D2 (open), A2 (midpoint), D2 (close). Cathedral reverb with 10 prime-number-ratio delay taps.
score_caption: Graphical Score — All squares = tubular bells across three octaves. Click to enlarge.

title: Cage Ambient — Drift with Interruptions
description: Continuous ambient bed (12-tone drift, sub-bass drones) periodically slapped by chance-determined prepared piano events: bolt clusters, screw cascades, keyboard runs, vocal screams. Auto-ducking silences the ambient bed after each interruption — the shock of absence. Cage's chance operations determine timing, type, and preparation.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Blue bars = ambient drift, pink cascades = interruptions, grey = ducking silence. Click to enlarge.

title: "One More Thing" — Paul's Voice Clone
description: Voice synthesis using formant data extracted via LPC analysis from Paul's actual voice recording: F0=92Hz, F1=673Hz, F2=996Hz, F3=3049Hz, F4=4780Hz. Five sections: ambient drift → voice emerges → call/response → climax with prepared piano → dissolution. The vocal formants are Paul's; the glottal source uses reduced spectral tilt (0.7) and sharper open quotient (0.45).

title: Berg Lyrical — Original
description: The anti-Webern. Lush, overlapping legato lines. 4 sections: Opening (two string voices) → Development (winds join, waltz fragments) → Tonal window (G minor triad emerges) → Dissolution. Triadic row outlines Gm, D, Am, E — then whole-tone ascent.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Overlapping legato lines, waltz fragments, tonal window in G minor. Click to enlarge.

title: Webern Pointillism
description: Derived row from trichord [0, 1, 4]. Isolated tones separated by silence, wide register leaps (3-5 octaves), Klangfarbenmelodie (each note gets its own timbre). The shared synthesis engine that powers all other compositions.
score_caption: Graphical Score — Isolated tones, wide register leaps, Klangfarbenmelodie. 60% silence. Click to enlarge.

title: Ambient Synthesis — Original POC
description: The original proof of concept. 5 layers: primary 12-tone row, inverted row, microtonal chaos, sub-bass, and chromatic clusters. Where it all started.
